Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Westgate Tenants Association Records TAM 521
1.5 Linear Feet in 1 record carton and 1 manuscript box
2000-2009 The Westgate Tenants Association represents the tenants of a "Mitchell-Lama" built housing project on New York City's Upper West Side, and in particular struggles to maintain rent stabilization against the project's new owner, who opted out of the Mitchell-Lama" program and seeks to achieve market-rate rents in the project. The collection contains correspondence, minutes, flyers, newsletters, clippings, research files, and government reports related to housing issues. Materials are in English 1-2
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Jean Green Dorsey on behalf of the Westgate Tenants Association in 2009. The accession number associated with this collection is 2009.093.
Historical/Biographical Note
The Westgate Tenants Association represents the tenants of a "Mitchell-Lama" built housing project on New York City's Upper West Side, and in particular struggles to maintain rent stabilization against the project's new owner, who opted out of the Mitchell-Lama" program and seeks to achieve market-rate rents in the project.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Scope and Contents
The collection contains correspondence, minutes, flyers, newsletters, clippings, research files, and government reports related to housing issues.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by the Westgate Tenants Association were transferred to New York University in 2009 Jean Green Dorsey. was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder.
